rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OETESTCD

self.title: Short Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam

datasetVariables.description: Short character value for OETEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in OETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). OETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "NUMLCOR".
datasetVariables.label: Short Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam
datasetVariables.name: OETESTCD

self.title: Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam

datasetVariables.label: Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam
datasetVariables.name: OETEST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OESTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from OEORRES in a standard format or in standard units. OESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in OESTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariables.name: OESTRESC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OESTRESN

datasetVariables.name: OESTRESN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OENRIND

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by OEORNRLO and OEORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N"; "HIGH", "LOW", "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL".
datasetVariables.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
datasetVariables.name: OENRIND

parentProduct.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.3 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OERESCAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results. Examples: "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE". The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided.
datasetVariables.label: Result Category
datasetVariables.name: OERESCAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OESTAT

datasetVariables.name: OESTAT

datasetVariables.name: OELOC

datasetVariables.name: OEMETHOD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OEBLFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that OEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: OEBLFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OEDRVFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OEEVAL

datasetVariables.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "INVESTIGATOR".
datasetVariables.label: Evaluator
datasetVariables.name: OEEVAL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OEEVALID

datasetVariables.label: Evaluator Identifier
datasetVariables.name: OEEVALID

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OEACPTFL

datasetVariables.description: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null.

datasetVariables.name: OEACPTFL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTMIG variable OE.OEREPNUM

datasetVariables.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary, e.g., within a time point or within a visit. For example, multiple measurements of blood pressure or multiple analyses of a sample.
datasetVariables.label: Repetition Number
datasetVariables.name: OEREPNUM

datasetVariables.name: OERFTDTC

description: A findings domain that contains tests that measure a person's ocular health and visual status, to detect abnormalities in the components of the visual system, and to determine how well the person can see. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C147180, 2018-06-29)
label: Ophthalmic Examinations
name: OE
